name: Forty Fifth Street Clinic(Neighborcare Health)
description: Neighborhood clinic for U. District, Wallingford, etc. Unlike other neighborhood clinics, they are not strict about geographic area. Outpatient services. Sliding scale fees and medical coupons. In addition, there is a drop-in clinic, including prenatal care, for homeless youth ages 14-23 only, Wednesday and Thursday evenings 6:00 pm - 9:00 pm. No appointment needed for homeless youth clinic only.
hours: Mon: 7:30 am - 7:00 pm, Tue: 7:30 am - 7:00 pm, Wed: 8:45 am - 5:30 pm, Thu: 7:30 am - 5:30 pm, Fri: 7:30 am - 5:30 pm, Sat: 9:30 am - 1:45 pm, Sun: CLOSED

name: Carolyn Downs Family Medical Center (Country Doctor Clinics)
description: Neighborhood clinic for Central Area, founded by the Seattle Black Panther Party and now a partner with the Country Doctor clinic. Outpatient services. Sliding scale fees and medical coupons. Additional services for Hispanic population.

name: Country Doctor Community Clinic
description: Neighborhood clinic for Capitol Hill. Outpatient services. WIC provider. Outreach services for diabetics. Onsite pharmacy. Sliding scale fees and medical coupons. By appointment only.
hours: Mon: 9:00 am – 12:30 pm; 1:30 pm – 5:00 pm, Tue: 9:00 am – 12:30 pm; 1:30 pm – 5:00 pm; 5:30 pm – 8:30 pm, Wed: 9:00 am – 12:30 pm; 1:30 pm – 5:00 pm; 5:30 pm – 8:30 pm, Thu: 9:00 am – 12:30 pm; 1:30 pm – 5:00 pm; 5:30 pm – 8:30 pm, Fri: 9:00 am – 12:30 pm; 1:30 pm – 5:00 pm, Sat (at Carolyn Downs Clinic, 2101 E. Yesler Way): 9:00 am – 12:00 noon, Sun: CLOSED

name: Pike Market Medical Clinic(Neighborcare Health)
description: Downtown neighborhood clinic for anyone age 18+. Primary care for elderly, homeless, HIV+. Sliding scale fees and medical coupons. Low cost pharmacy.
hours: Mon: 8:00 am – 5:00 pm; walk-in appointments available until 3:00 pm, Tue: 8:00 am – 5:00 pm; walk-in appointments available until 3:00 pm, Wed: 9:30 am – 5:00 pm; walk-in appointments available until 3:00 pm, Thu: 8:00 am – 5:00 pm; walk-in appointments available until 3:00 pm, Fri: 8:00 am – 4:00 pm; walk-in appointments available until 2:00 pm, Sat: CLOSED, Sun: CLOSED

name: Pioneer Square Clinic (UW Medicine)
description: Neighborhood clinic for age 18+ for Downtown. Primary care for elderly, homeless, low income. Sliding scale fees and medical coupons. A University of Washington Medical clinic.
hours: Mon: 7:00 am – 5:00 pm, Tue: 7:00 am – 5:00 pm, Wed: 8:00 am – 5:00 pm, Thu: 7:00 am – 5:00 pm, Fri: 7:00 am – 5:00 pm, Sat: CLOSED, Sun: CLOSED

name: Children's Hospital
address: 4800 Sand Point Way NE; Seattle, WA 98105
description: Extensive services for children. Sliding scale fees and medical coupons. Referral from a primary care provider is required for non-urgent services. Urgent care (less expensive than an emergency room visit) does not require a referral or appointment. Available at Children’s Hospital clinics in Seattle, Bellevue, and Mill Creek. Urgent care hours only: Monday through Friday: 5 pm to 10:30 pm; Saturday, Sunday and holidays: 11 am to 8 pm.

name: Harborview Madison Clinic
address: Harborview Medical Center - 2nd Floor, West Clinic; 325 Ninth Avenue, Seattle
description: Medical care and social services for persons living with HIV/AIDS regardless of sexual orientation, race, or ability to pay. New patients: call 206-744-5155 to schedule first appointment. Routine appointments: 206-520-5000. Established patients may be seen on an urgent walk-in basis by calling the clinic and speaking with a triage nurse.

name: Urban Rest Stop
description: Besides the showers, laundry facilities, and hygiene supplies for which they are generally known, Urban Rest Stop also has a Health Room offering free health care. Services: emergency first aid, preventative health care, prenatal care, referrals to other community health services. On the fourth Monday of every month, foot care is also available. Health Room: Monday, Wednesday and Friday, 8:30 am to 11:30 pm.

name: Odessa Brown Children's Clinic (operated by Children's Hospital)
address: 2101 E. Yesler Way Suite 100; Seattle, WA 98122
description: Outpatient medical, dental, and Mental Health services for youth (newborn to 18 years). Medical coupons and insurance accepted. WIC provider. No child will be refused services.

name: Cedar River Clinics
address: 4300 Talbot Road South, Suite 403; Renton, WA 98055
description: Pregnancy testing, pregnancy options counseling, all methods of birth control (Take Charge provider), STD and HIV testing and counseling, first and second trimester abortion. Teens welcome. Medical interpreters arranged for limited English clients. Payment options for abortion include insurance, Alaska Medicaid, Oregon Health Plan, WA DSHS Medical Coupons. Phones are answered Monday to Friday 8:00 am to 5:00pm and Saturday 9:00 am to 2:00 pm. Also operates similar clinics in Tacoma and Yakima.

name: Country Doctor Free Teen Clinic
description: No appointments: drop-in medical services only. Serves homeless youth ages 12-23. No money, no insurance, no coupons necessary. No cost for medicine or lab work. STD, anonymous HIV testing, pregnancy tests, general physicals, and sick care. Licensed Acupuncturist, and Licensed Massage Therapist available Tuesdays only. Monday & Tuesday only, 6:00 p.m - 9:00 p.m. at Country Doctor Clinic, 500 19th Ave. E.

name: Seattle Indian Health Board
address: 611 12th Avenue S., Suite 200; Seattle, WA 98144 (The Leschi Center)
description: Health services (including dental, in- and out-patient alcohol/drug counseling) targeting Native Americans but available to all. WIC provider. Sliding scale fee and medical coupons. Mon-Fri 8:30 a.m - 6:00 p.m.; Sat 9:00 a.m - 2:00 p.m. (limited services); Sun CLOSED

name: DOWNTOWN Robert Clewis Center
description: Walk-ins welcome! Abscess treatment and care, HIV/hepatitis testing and counseling, Hepatitis A and B vaccinations, Colds and upper respiratory infections, TB screening, Narcan available

name: U. District Needle Exchange
address: NE 43rd & Univ. Way NE, Seattle, WA 98145
description: Hypodermic needles can be exchanged for free at the table in the alley behind the U. District Post office (1/2 block east of University Way NE — 'The Ave' — just south of 43rd Street), operated by the People's Harm Reduction Alliance. Also condoms, AIDS information.
hours: Mon: 5pm – 7pm, Tue: 5pm – 7pm (All Female Staff), Thu: 5pm – 7pm, Fri: 1pm – 5pm, Sun: 1pm – 5pm

name: CAPITOL HILL Robert Clewis Center 2
hours: Mon-Sat: 5:30pm - 8:30pm

name: ABLE Care Clinic
address: Cabrini Tower, 901 Boren Ave, Suite 701; Seattle, WA 98104
description: Low cost counseling services provided by supervised student interns. Available for individuals who are underinsured, uninsured or do not have the means to afford therapy. Counseling is available for adults, couples, teens, and families who are experiencing anxiety, depression, grief/loss, life transitions and more. By appointment only.

name: Atlantic Street Center
description: Programs for low-income children, youth and families of color in Seattle’s central and southeast neighborhoods. Therapists provide mental health counseling for youth and families dealing with difficult issues: depression, divorce, trauma recovery, unstable life situations, domestic violence, loss and abuse. Atlantic Street Center services are free to participants.

name: Seattle Counseling Service
description: Mental health services for the LGBT community, adults and youth. Sliding scale, medical coupons accepted. After hours, call the Crisis Line, 1-866-4CRISIS (1-866-427-4747).

name: University District Youth Center
description: On-site individual mental health, drug, and alcohol counseling for at-risk, runaway, homeless and street-involved youth, 13-22. All services free by appointment.

name: Northwest Family Life
description: Counseling for individuals, couples, groups. Sliding scale available. This is a Christian faith-based organization with a particular emphasis on domestic violence.

name: ACRS
address: 3639 Martin Luther King Jr. Way S; Seattle, WA 98144
description: Formerly Asian Counseling and Referral Service. Variety of mental health services including case management and psychiatric evaluation. Medicaid, Basic Health, and selected private insurances, including Group Health, Molina and Regence Blue Shields. Sliding scale, free to those who meet income guidelines. Also has an office in Bellevue.

name: Seattle Indian Health Board
address: 611 12th Avenue S., Suite 200; Seattle, WA 98144 (The Leschi Center)
description: ndividual, couples and family counseling, crisis intervention, medications, and medication management and evaluation. Medicaid and Medicare, public and private insurance accepted, sliding scale.

name: University of Washington Center for Anxiety and Traumatic Stress
address: Guthrie Annex II, 2nd Floor; University of Washington
description: This program has a federal grant through 2015 to conduct research and treatment for post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). Because they receive funding for their research, they are able to offer no-cost services to eligible individuals who are experiencing trauma-related problems. Individuals who are 18 years or older may be eligible for this research study that offers 10 weeks of counseling or counseling plus medication. For more information, call 206-685-3617 or visit website http://www.ptsdoptions.com.

name: Compass Housing Alliance
description: Mail, banking, message phone for homeless, "protective payee", hygiene center (shower and toilets). Transitional housing and some permanent low income housing units for adults and families. Showers and laundry offered from 7 a.m. - 2:30 p.m. Call for other services: schedules vary.

name: PETER’S PLACE
description: People can seek refuge, meals and basic services as well as connect with case management, entitlements and other benefits, mental health counseling and nursing services.

name: Downtown Emergency Service Center (DESC)
description: Women age 18+ (no minors) and men 60+ are welcome. Men 18-59 only if severely disabled, mentally ill, physically or developmentally disabled, medically/physically compromised, chemically dependent (and working with a counselor). Free mental health screening/referrals; free mail service for night shelter residents; non-12-step support and shelter referrals for chemically dependent homeless. Open for day services 7:30 a.m. - 5 p.m. Night shelter for priority clients.

name: Lazarus Day Center
address: 416 Second Ave Ext S., Seattle, WA 98104
description: Provides safe daytime shelter and services for homeless and low-income men and women aged 50 and older, including meals, snacks, haircuts, clothing, laundry facilities and showers, library, drug and alcohol counseling. 1 p.m. – 6:30 p.m. 7 days a week. Transportation provided to St. Martin De Porres Shelter upon approval.

name: Chief Seattle Club
description:
"A sacred space for homeless and at-risk American Indian and Alaska Native people." Must be Alaska Native or American Indian with Tribal ID.Member services Monday-Friday 7 a.m. - 2 p.m. Nutritious breakfast; showers, laundry, clothing, access to health care, drug, and alcohol treatment.
Also financial assistance, housing, medical, clothing, and utilities: call for details.

name: YWCA
description: WorkSource Opportunity Place : Job listings, other job search help, including access to phone, computer, job-hunting workshops & classes. Monday-Friday 8:30 a.m. - 5 p.m.

name: Food Not Bombs
description: Vegetarian dinner served every Sunday approximately 4 pm in Occidental Park (in the Pioneer Square neighborhood). Usually also has free produce and bread.
hours: Sun: Approximately 4pm

name: Millionair Club Charity
hours: Mon-Sat: 6:15 am - 7 am, Mon-Fri: 12 noon - 1:30 pm, Closed Sundays.

name: Blessed Sacrament Church
description: Food baskets with ID Friday 10:30 am - 12 noon. For food baskets, must have ID demonstrating residency in area bounded by the Ship Canal/ Lake Union, First Ave NE, 20th Ave NE, and NE 70th Street. Bus routes 66-67.
hours: Meal Sunday, 12 noon - 2 pm at Parish Hall on 8th Avenue side of building, open to all.

name: Immanuel Lutheran
description: Community meal last Sunday of each month at 12 noon.

name: Seattle Indian Center
description: Open to people of all ethnicities.
hours: Breakfast Mon-Fri: 9:30 am - 11:00 am, Lunch Mon-Fri: 12 noon - 1:15 pm, Food Bank Tuesday & Thursday 1:30 pm – 3:30 pm

name: Phinney Neighborhood Soup Kitchen
address: St. John's Lutheran Church, 5515 Phinney Ave. N., Seattle 98103
description:
Monday dinner. Doors open 4 pm, dinner 5 pm - 6pm.
Free meals at St. John's Lutheran Church (across from Woodland Park Zoo, on #5 bus route). Open to all, all are welcome.
hours: Tuesday dinner. Doors open 4 pm, dinner 5 pm - 6pm, Wednesday lunch. Doors open 11 am, lunch 12 noon - 1pm.

name: Community Lunch on Capitol Hill
description: Open to all, all are welcome.
hours: Lunch Tuesday & Friday, 12 noon – 1 pm

name: Community Lunch on Capitol Hill
address: 500 Broadway East (entrance is on Republican); Seattle, WA 98102
description: Open to all, all are welcome.
hours: Dinner Wednesday and Thursday 5 pm – 6 pm

name: ROOTS Young Adult Shelter
description: "Friday Feast". Go downstairs at University Methodist Temple Church, enter via the alley behind the post office through the blue doors at the south end of the church. Unlike other ROOTS activities and services, this is open to all ages.
hours: Fridays 5:30 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Union Gospel Mission
address: 318 Second Ave. Ext. S; Seattle, WA 98104
hours: Breakfast Everyday 7:30 am 9:00 am, Lunch Monday-Saturday 11:30 am - 12:30 pm, Dinner Everyday 5:30-6:30 pm

name: Bread of Life Mission
description:
"All welcome" For over night stays: $5 fee + valid ID required, men age 18+ only
Doors close at 8:15 pm.
hours: Coffee and assorted snacks Monday-Friday, 9:30 am - 3 pm, Lunch Monday-Friday, 12:15 pm - 1 pm, Chapel 6:30-7:10 pm (Tue.-Sat.), Dinner (Mon. 6:30 pm; Tue-Sat 7:15 pm), Overnight bed sign-up from 5:30-6:15 pm and 8:00-8:15 pm

name: The Helping House
description: Free new and clean gently used clothing for women, men, teens, children and infants. All occasions - dress, school, casual and professional wear for work or office. Shoes, coats, hats and household items also available.
hours: 1st and 3rd Saturdays of each month from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.

name: CityTeam Ministries
description: Available to women & children by appointment only. Available to men in the evenings during shelter hours.

name: University District Youth Center
description: Open to youth ages 13-22 only.

name: Union Gospel Mission
address: 318 Second Ave. Ext. S; Seattle, WA 98104
description: Men only clothing service.
hours: Apply for voucher Mon-Sat before 11:00am, Clothing pick-up between 1:30-2:30 pm

name: St. Francis House
description: Furniture, household goods, and clothing. ID required.
hours: Mon-Fri: 10 am - 2:30 pm

name: Operation Nightwatch Emergency Shelter
description:
Nighttime drop-in center at 302 14th Avenue South (between Yesler & Jackson on the corner of 14th and Main). Open nights, not days. Screening and referrals done every night starting 9pm until midnight. Please do not arrive early. Age 18 and over only.  Operation Nightwatch no longer is able to assist families with children.

Men who do not already have a valid ticket from Operation Nightwatch must have a referral ticket from the Downtown Emergency Service Center, 507 3rd Ave Seattle, or Bread of Life Mission, 97 South Main Street. Please check with these agencies for distribution times and availability.

Referrals are not required for women.

name: Downtown Emergency Service Center (DESC)
description:
Rather than providing shelter on a first-come-first-served model, DESC uses a Vulnerability Assessment and tries to serve those evaluated as most vulnerable.
Information and referral drop-in hours Monday-Friday 9-11 a.m. and 2-4 p.m.

The DESC Emergency Shelter serves women age 18+ and men age 60+. Men 18-59 are also served if severely disabled, mentally ill, physically or developmentally disabled, medically/physically compromised, or chemically dependent (and working with a counselor). DESC also offers a daytime program (7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m) and manages eleven supportive housing projects.

name: Saint Martin dePorres Shelter
description: Operates at its full capacity of 212 men a night. The shelter is open 365 nights a year from 6:30 p.m. to 7:30 a.m. and during the day for medical convalescent care. During the winter months, they have arrangements with eight local churches to provide space for an additional 34 men a night. To access services, visit the Lazarus Day Center at 416 2nd Avenue before 7:00 p.m. daily.
hours: Everday, arrive before 7pm

name: Union Gospel Mission
address: 318 Second Ave. Ext. S; Seattle, WA 98104
description: Shelter for men, no fee, following chapel at 7 p.m. 110 mats available.

name: William Booth Center
description:
Men's facility. Breathalizer, drug test required. Several options:

Limited number of emergency beds.
Dormitory-style transitional shelter, $70/week, bunk bed plus locker (6 month limit, meals not provided).
Transitional housing at 30% of gross income. Case manager available.

name: Bread of Life Mission
description:
In Pioneer Square neighborhood. Day Shelter every Monday through Friday from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m (men, women, and children). Mail Services, clothing, lockers (minimal fee), media center (computers with internet access and television), Metro bus passes, hot lunch, social services and referrals.

Night shelter (men only).

name: Seattle Indian Center
description: Sea’ Sha Inn (men’s hostel), 7 nights a week, 7 p.m. to 7 a.m.; cots & blankets, shower, kitchen, TV; free local calls, continental breakfast.
hours: Everyday, arrive before 7pm

name: Salvation Army Women's Shelter
description: Shelter for single women age 18+.

name: Noel House Women's Referral Center
description: Women only shelter, 18+, 40 beds, referrals to other shelters. Evening meals. Doesn't turn away women with mental/physical disabilities or addiction issues. Open registration nightly 6-8 p.m.
hours: Everyday, register between 6 and 8 pm

name: Church of Mary Magdalene / Mary's Place
description:
The Rotating Night Shelter accommodates fourteen people (5-6 families) from Mary’s Place, moves to 13 different faith communities, each congregation hosting one week per quarter, four weeks per year.

Emergency Family Night Shelter (EFS), in partnership with the Union Gospel Mission, is an emergency night shelter for up to 48 women and children from Mary’s Place who are waiting to be referred to a longer-term night shelter.

name: YWCA
description: YWCA Emergency Shelter: The YWCA provides a safe haven for women and their children fleeing domestic violence. All women 18 years old and their children are eligible. No boys over the age of 17. Women undergo an intensive telephone screening by calling the number above to determine if this shelter will meet their needs.

name: Julia’s Place Night Shelter (operated by Mary's Place)
description: Julia’s Place Night Shelter is operated by Mary's place and hosted at the Madrona Grace Church. Five intact families (men, women and children) from Mary’s Place can stay overnight while waiting for permanent housing.

name: Urban Rest Stop
description:
Free showers and laundry facilities for homeless and low income. Will lend coveralls for patrons who have nothing to wear while doing laundry.

Free hygiene supplies such as soap, toothbrushes, diapers, feminine hygiene supplies, etc.
hours: Mon-Thu: 5:30 am - 9:30 pm, Fri: 5:30 am - 11 am, 2 pm - 9:30 pm, Sat-Sun: June 1 - Sept 30: 8 am - 5 pm, Sat-Sun: Oct 1 - May 31: 8 am - 3 pm. Closed holidays.

name: Urban Rest Stop
description:
Free showers and laundry facilities for homeless and low income. Will lend coveralls for patrons who have nothing to wear while doing laundry.

Free hygiene supplies such as soap, toothbrushes, diapers, feminine hygiene supplies, etc.

Directions: Entrance to left of Cheryl Chow Court entrance, at 2014-B NW 57th St.
hours: Mon-Fri 6:30 am- 2:30 pm. Closed weekends, holidays.

name: Urban Rest Stop
description:
Free showers and laundry facilities for homeless and low income. Will lend coveralls for patrons who have nothing to wear while doing laundry.

Free hygiene supplies such as soap, toothbrushes, diapers, feminine hygiene supplies, etc.

Directions: the entrance is on the alley that runs from NE 42nd Street to NE 43rd Street between 15th Ave NE and University Way NE. It is in the back of University Methodist Temple. If you come north from 42nd Street, go past the Allegro coffeeshop, and look for the blue handrails on the right.
hours: Tue-Thu: 9:00 am - 12 noon, 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm, Fri: 9:00 am - 12 noon, 1:00 pm - 5:30 pm. Closed Mondays, weekends, holidays.

name: Greenlake Community Center
description: Free showers. Enter through lobby.
hours: Mon-Fri: 10 am - 8 pm, Sat: 9 am - 4:30 pm. Closed Sundays and holidays.

name: Compass Housing Alliance
description: Showers and laundry. Please call for schedule.

name: Union Gospel Mission
address: 318 Second Ave. Ext. S; Seattle, WA 98104
description: Free showers (men only)
hours: Mon-Fri, except last Thursday of each month. Hygiene supplies availlable betwee 2 - 5 pm

name: Connections
description: Free showers, hygiene supplies, laundry, & computer use for homeless individuals actively seeking employment & willing to sign-up for program.
hours: Everyday: 7 am - 7 pm

name: Millionair Club Charity
description: Free showers, laundry (soap, towels, detergent provided). NOTE: Showers are only for people who are signed up for their day labor program.
hours: Mon-Fri: 6:30 am - 2:30 pm

name: Angeline's Day Center
description: Showers, laundry, phone, computers, legal advice, and healthcare for women only.
hours: Everyday: 8 am - 6 pm

name: Immanuel Lutheran
description: Showers and laundry service for men and women.
hours: Showers Mon-Fri: 8 am - 11:30 am, Laundry Mon-Fri: 8 am - 9:30 am

name: Family & Adult Service Center (FASC)
description: Laundry & showers available to both men & women. Towels & soap provided. Sign-up that morning for a time slot for either service or both.
hours: Everyday: 11 am - 7 pm

name: Capitol Hill Branch Seattle Public Library
hours: Mon - Thurs: 10:00 am to 8:00 pm Fri, Sat: 10:00 am to 6:00 pm Sun: 1:00 pm to 5:00 pm

name: Belltown Community Center
hours: Mon, Wed: 3:00 pm to 8:00 pm Tues, Thurs, Fri: 9:30 am to 2:30 pm Sat, Sun: Closed

name: Central Branch Seattle Public Library
hours: Mon - Thurs: 10:00 am to 8:00 pm Fri, Sat: 10:00 am to 6:00 pm Sun: noon to 6:00 pm

name: Yesler Computer Lab
hours: Tues, Thurs: 10:00 am to noon

name: International District/Chinatown Community Center
hours: Mon, Fri: 11:00 am to 9:00 pm Tues: 3:00 pm to 6:00 pm Wed: Noon to 9:00 pm Thurs: 9:00 am to noon Sat, Sun: Closed

name: International District/Chinatown Branch Seattle Public Library
hours: Mon, Tues: 1:00 pm to 8:00 pm Wed, Thurs, Sat: 11:00 am to 6:00 pm Sun: 1:00 pm to 5:00 pm Fri: Closed

hours: Mon - Thurs: 10:00 am to 8:00 pm Fri, Sat: 10:00 am to 6:00 pm Sun: 1:00 pm to 5:00 pm

name: Central Neighborhood Service Center
address: 2301 S Jackson St Suite. 200, Seattle, WA 98144
hours: Mon - Fri: 9:00 am to 7:00 pm Sat: 9:00 am to 5:00 pm

name: Miller Community Center
hours: Mon - Fri: 4:00 pm to 9:00 pm Tues: 9:30 am to 12:30 pm, 4:00 pm to 9:00 pm Sat, Sun: Closed

name: Fremont Branch Seattle Public Library
hours: Mon, Tues: 1:00 pm to 8:00 pm Wed, Thurs, Sat: 11:00 am to 6:00 pm Sun: 1:00 pm to 5:00 pm Fri: Closed

name: University District Neighborhood Service Center
hours: Monday to Friday 10 AM to 6 PM; Saturday 10 AM to 2 PM

name: University Branch Seattle Public Library
hours: Mon, Tues: 1:00 pm to 8:00 pm Wed, Thurs, Sat: 11:00 am to 6:00 pm Sun: 1:00 pm to 5:00 pm Fri: Closed
